snippet: California’s ballot propositions include several from billionaires, a sign that the wealthy are using “super PACs”  to influence politics in the nation’s most populous state.
abstract: Four of the eleven ballot propositions in California's upcoming election have been sponsored by billionaires to advance their pet projects, which involve out-of-state company tax benefits, auto insurance laws, human traffickers and tax initiatives; referendums are sign of the increasingly sophisticated way that the wealthy are influencing politics in the nation's most populous state.
lead_paragraph: California’s ballot propositions include several from billionaires, a sign that the wealthy are using “super PACs”  to influence politics in the nation’s most populous state.

headline.seo: California Ballot Initiatives Dominated by the Very Rich
headline.main: California Ballot Initiatives, Born in Populism, Now Come From Billionaires
headline.print_headline: California Ballot Initiatives, Born in Populism, Now Come From Billionaires
